Description: The NYNY Ruby Framework offers developers a micro web framework for testing applications on modern browsers. It's features include Rack middleware that allows for the use inside of Sinatra, Rails, and other Rack-based apps and being ~300 LOC in size.

The Grape Ruby Framework allows for the building of lightweight APIs with Ruby when a larger framework like Ruby on Rails isn't needed. It aims to be a REST-like API micro-framework built to work with existing web application frameworks by providing DSL to provide APIs. The framework's features include: built-in support for common conventions such as multiple formats, subdomain/prefix restriction, and versioning.

The Nancy Framework aims to be a minimal Ruby microframework for web development inspired in the Sinatra and Cuba frameworks. The framework's features include: routes such as support for get, post, put, patch, delete, options, head; set basic filters/callbacks with the before/after methods; and template rendering and caching through Tilt or ERB from stdlib.
The Cuba Ruby Framework is a microframework that offers developers a mapper for Rack applications, inspired by Rum, a unified mapper for Rack applications.

The Scorched framework is a Ruby framework that aims to be a generic, DRY, light-weight web framework for Ruby. It offers a generic set of constructs for processing HTTP requests, with websites and applications of different scales can be used to be built.

The Stapes.js JavaScript framework aims to allow the design of an application to be objective on the setup and style of coding. The framework allows for developers to code using models, views and controllers, modules, jQuery, Zepto, React, and many others.
Wru is a JavaScript framework that intends to offer an essential, general purpose test framework compatible with web environment, node.js,Rhino, and PhantomJS.
The Nerve JavaScript Framework by Jstandish aims to be an asynchronous javascript micro framework for event broadcasts along routes and channels.

The JavaScript framework Guggenheim.js offers developers a framework for agnostic plugin to create interactive galleries. It uses CSS3 animation (with a fallback to Javascript) to create animated filtering, reordering and pagination of a gallery.

The PHP version of Pattern Lab aims to be a static site generator. The framework combines platform-agnostic assets, like the Mustache-based patterns and the JavaScript-based viewer, with a PHP-based "builder" that builds the Pattern Lab site. By making it a static site generator, Pattern Lab aims to separate patterns, data, and presentation from build logic.

The Node.js framework Style Guide aims to be a simple styleguide framework. It offers developers aninstall component-styleguide into a styleguide project with minimal impact. The frameworks realted to http://patternlab.io.
The Nuclear JavaScript Framework by Optimizely aims to be a reactive flux built with ImmutableJS data structures.
The JSBlocks JavaScript Framework by Antonio Stoilkov offers developers a user interface for complex single-page applications using a server-side rendered framework

The JavaScript Framework WebRx aims to be a Javascript MVVM-Framework built on ReactiveX for Javascript (RxJs) that combines functional-reactive programming with Observable-driven declarative Data-Binding, Features also include templating and Client-Side Routing.
The Phaser JavaScript Framework by Richard Davey is intended to be a free 2D game framework for making HTML5 games for desktop and mobile web browsers, supporting Canvas and WebGL rendering.

The Opentip JavaScript Framework by Matias Meno aims to be a javascript tooltip. It offers uses for adapters to make the framework available for all major frameworks and provides a native adapter that works without a framework.

The MVC framework is intended for JavaScript applications. The framework is aimed at developers who use real MVC such as The Smalltalk MVC and The Gang of Four MVC. The framework is written in JavaScript.

The Qunit JavaScript Framework by jQuery aims to be a powerful JavaScript unit testing framework. The framework is intended for jQuery UI and jQuery Mobile projects and allows for testing generic JavaScript code including the framework itself.
The Derby Framework offers developers a MVC framework to write realtime, collaborative applications that run in both Node.js and browsers.
The Mithril JavaScript Framework by Leo Horie aims to be a client-side MVC framework, The framework offers developers a tool to organize code in a way that facilitates maintenance and organization.

The JavaScript framework by Sebastian Müller allows for developers to create a JavaScript and Node.js Framework for accessing basic Arduino controls from Web Applications using HTML5, Socket.IO and Node.js.

Prototype is a JavaScript framework that aims to ease development of dynamic web applications. It offers a familiar class-style OO framework, extensive Ajax support, higher-order programming constructs, and easy DOM manipulation.

The Aurelia Framework aims to be a library that offers part of the Aurelia platform and contains the aurelia framework which brings together all the required core aurelia libraries into an application-building platform.

Babylon.js aims to be a complete JavaScript framework for building 3D games with HTML 5 and WebGL. A web browser is required to run the framework, and it currently supports Internet Explorer 11+, Firefox 4+, Google Chrome 9+, Opera 12+ and others.
The ColorBox JavaScript Framework by Jack Moore offers developers a customizable lightbox plugin for jQuery.
The Holder.js Framework aims to render image placeholders entirely in a browser. The framework offers customer colors, fonts, resizing behavior, and rendering engine.

FlexSlider JavaScript Framework aims to be a responsive Jquery slider toolkit. The framework offers developers support for all major browsers, callback API, multiple slider support, and customer navigation options.

The Interact.js JavaScript Framework aims to offer developers a testing environment that allows them to drop, resize and multi-touch gestures with inertia and snapping for modern browsers. Features include cross browser and device support, interaction with SVG elements, and others.
